Job Description:

Reporting to the Director of Research Analytics and Reporting (Global Marketing), the Manager will be directly involved in the integration and analysis of Voice of the Client data to evolve Sun Life’s Client experience strategy. The role will execute on work across the enterprise (Canada, US and Asia) to integrate and analyze Client feedback sources to provide a comprehensive Voice of the Client lens to the organization.
Specific Responsibilities:
Analyze and integrate Voice of the Client data across multiple business lines in Canada, US and Asia while working with senior team leaders to identify actionable insights to support the development and execution of Sun Life’s client experience strategy
Help drive a comprehensive Client-centric strategy by proactively delivering insights across the organization that reinforce overall drivers of Client experience and by providing actionable recommendations for improvements
Work with team members to integrate attitudinal and behavioural data to tell a rich Client experience story across all research engagements
Mandatory Requirements:
Proficient at using Tableau to create data visualizations of survey research results (experience creating dashboards in Qualtrics an asset)

Robust data analytic skillset with direct experience conducting, interpreting and visualizing advanced analytical analysis
Strong proficiency with statistical analysis software (SPSS/R) and the Microsoft Office suite (notably Excel and PowerPoint)
Strong project management skills with the ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously
Capable of managing multiple market research projects through every stage of the project lifecycle from needs identification to reporting
Exceptional communication and writing skills
Comfortable working in a matrix-style organization with multiple stakeholders across the globe
Leadership:
High level of initiative to prioritize work amidst competing demands and to take projects from the briefing phase to the delivery of final reports/presentations with supervision from senior team leaders
High degree of self-awareness and understands his/her impact on others
An effective listener who seeks to understand first and offers positive/flexible solutions to problems
A team player who works well with cross-functional teams across the enterprise
Energetic, self-starter who enjoys sharing insights in creative and engaging ways
Education and qualifications:
The successful candidate will hold a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Market Research, Statistics, Consumer Behavior or equivalent
5+ years of relevant experience with preference given to those with both client and vendor experience

jobTitle: Senior Analyst, FIU Strategy and Analytics - Tangerine
jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 88698
Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

At Tangerine, our purpose is to deliver best in class banking solutions to Canadians. We take a hands-on approach to challenges and always seek out opportunities to improve. Building a career at Tangerine is more than just a job; we are committed to making a difference in the lives of Canadians.
Who said that you have to hide your personality to deliver business results? We certainly do not, and that is what has made Tangerine a success. Come be a part of our collaborative, energetic and passionate client-centric team and continue to drive Forward Banking solutions for all Canadians.

Department Summary:
The Tangerine FIU (“FIU”) is responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining the Tangerine Anti-Money Laundering/ Anti-Terrorist Financing Program. Tangerine Bank is subject to, and must comply with many Regulations promulgated by governments, regulators and self-regulating bodies. The Department is responsible for ensuring that Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations as well as head office minimum standards. The Department is also responsible for ensuring adherence to sanctions regulations.
Role Purpose:
The Senior Analyst, FIU Strategy and Analytics reports to the Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics. The Senior Analyst, FIU Strategy & Analytics is responsible for defining, investigating, and developing solutions to support the systems used in the Tangerine FIU (including but not limited to the Transaction Monitoring, Name Screening and Case Management systems). Additionally, the role will be leading and participating in initiatives to identify and action opportunities for local improvements to productivity, decision effectiveness, and the user experience.
Is this Role right for You?
Perform ongoing development and management of FIU systems, rules and deployed solutions.
Perform the monitoring and maintenance of FIU strategies to address evolving trends.
Institute and manage a disciplined change process for regular testing and deployment of FIU rules.
Perform analytics and reporting to generate an accurate and insightful perspective on rule effectiveness, detection rates, false positive rates and volume.
Drive robust processes to enhance FIU Systems performance.
Maintain thorough understanding of FIU Systems capabilities, gaps and opportunities.
Provide analytic support in the development and implementation of FIU strategic plans.
Support the ongoing and periodic evaluation of existing and new FIU Systems tools and solutions to address changing business needs and emerging threats.
Assist in the review and evaluation of business initiatives, product and projects with respect to FIU implications and formulate insightful guidance and input to senior business leaders.
Ensure accuracy and effectiveness of FIU systems and drive periodic enhancements as needed.
Responsible for the implementation of the quality assurance and testing strategy for the FIU
Skills you need to Succeed?
University or College Degree or equivalent work experience
Minimum 3-5 years of work related experience within the Financial Services industry
Minimum 2 year experience in Compliance and AML/ATF
Experience in consumer banking products (credit, deposit and cards)
ACAMs certification is considered an asset
Knowledge of Compliance and AML/ATF systems and troubleshooting experience
Strong and proven analytical skills
Strong working knowledge of data mining tools
Strong working knowledge of programing languages (Visual Basic, SQL)
Strong technical solution management experience and skills

What’s in it for you.
You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team
We offer a competitive rewards package
Performance bonus, Share Ownership Program, and Pension Plan Matching
Health Benefits from day one!
Office perks: free healthy snacks (chocolate is healthy, right?) subsidized on-site cafeteria and parking
You will enjoy work life balance, team events, and opportunities to volunteer in the community.
Your career matters! You will have access to career development and progression opportunities.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : North York
At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

employer: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
jobDescription:
The Institute for Mental Health Policy Research (IMHPR) at the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is home to leading scientific experts who are dedicated to informing policy and practice on mental illness. IMHPR scientists conduct collaborative research on communities, populations, health systems, and global health, and they develop and evaluate prevention and intervention initiatives. The IMHPR is committed to equity, informed by the social determinants of health. The IMHPR is currently seeking a research assistant who will report to the Head of the World Health Organization / Pan American Health Organization Collaborating Centre in Addiction and Mental Health at CAMH.
The Research Analyst must demonstrate a methodological understanding of and advanced skills in systematic reviews, risk measurement, and the measurement of alcohol at the population level using various data sources including general population surveys. The research Analyst will be responsible for systematically reviewing articles concerning (a) the impact of economic crises and natural disasters on alcohol consumption and its harms, and (b) surveys of adolescents and their alcohol consumption. Further, he or she must also demonstrate a methodological understanding of the standardization of data from different sources by correcting for various differences in study design. Finally, the research Analyst must demonstrate a methodological understanding of curating databases. The research Analyst will support a healthy workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork, and complies with all applications and regulatory requirements. This position is currently located at CAMH, 33 Ursula Street, Toronto.
Qualifications:
The successful applicants will have at a Bachelor’s degree in the social or health sciences combined with one (1) years’ experience in research, applicants whose previous experience has focused on systematic reviews would be an asset. A publication record and proven aptitude in writing peer-reviewed publications is an asset. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities is essential. Superior communication (verbal/written), interpersonal, and organizational skills are essential. The candidate will have a demonstrated ability in the design and management of research that includes data collection, the management and analysis of quantitative data, the use of statistical software (R, SPSS, Mplus, STATA, SAS), and the writing of reports and papers. Expertise in qualitative data collection and analytic approaches is considered an asset. The ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues, decision makers, and the scientific community is required. The candidate must be able to work effectively within an interdisciplinary team and interact comfortably with diverse community partners while conducting his or her own independent research. The ability to work with individuals of diverse ethno-racial and cultural backgrounds is required. Bilingualism (English/French) and/or proficiency in a second language are considered assets.
Please Note: These two (2) full-time (6 month) contract positions are part of the OPSEU bargaining unit.
Salary Range: $24.60 – $32.81 per hour

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.
CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.
As an employment equity employer CAMH actively seeks Aboriginal peoples, visible minorities, women, people with disabilities, (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges), and additional diverse identities for our workforce.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If contacted for an interview, please inform us should accommodation be required.

SNAP Financial Group is a payment solutions company that offers point of sale financing in Home Improvement. Our loan origination systems are a critical part of our competitive strategy. Since 2006, SNAP has been helping businesses grow across Canada. We have partnered with some of North America’s leading brands in the home improvement space to put innovative financing programs in place. Our home improvement payment solutions make it possible for homeowners across North America to improve the comfort and enjoyment of their homes.

With offices in Toronto and Vancouver, SNAP is a fast growing consumer finance company. We provide a competitive salary, bonus structure, benefits plan and a fun and professional, team-focused working environment.

We are actively recruiting for Director, Reporting & Analytics to join our team in our Toronto office. This role will be best suited for an individual who is self-motivated, results oriented and has a strong desire to succeed. Reporting directly to the Chief Financial Officer, this individual will primarily be responsible for the development and implementation of data integration, along with the development, implementation and ongoing management of data integration and reporting solutions in SQL, SAS or other data management software as well as development and maintenance of the company’s Microsoft PowerBI based reporting platform.

Please visit www.snapfinancial.com for more information.

RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

Development and implementation for data integration solutions using SQL, SAS and other data management software
Manage company wide requests for data and reporting needs; prioritize work load and work across business units as a business partner
Develop, maintain, and manage the company’s PowerBi based reporting platform
Proven track record as a technical project manager delivering data management solutions for business users
Able to clearly communicate and document with technical resources and business users to develop solutions

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

A completed undergraduate or other advanced degree in a quantitative discipline with applicable work experience in data management
A minimum of 7 years of experience in financial services or related industry
A minimum of 5 years using SQL and one or more scripting languages in a data science / warehouse / management, financial analysis, or business intelligence role
Experience integrating financial and operational data from more than one system of record
Practical experience with self-auditing the solution before delivery and development of solutions without technical requirements or project plans
Experience with Base SAS – SAS/STAT – SAS/GRAPH – Visual Studios / SSIS – or other comparable data analytical software tool
Experience with ETL and warehouse integration for financial lending data: lending lifecycle, Metro2, eOscar, FDR, Credit Files preferred

KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Ability to understand and explain each discipline of analytics, data management and programming and their differences
High attention to detail, accuracy and good documentation habits
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Developed judgment and problem solving skills sufficient to analyze information with the ability to interpret general procedures or approaches to formulate response/recommendations to problems
Advanced writing skills sufficient to prepare written materials involving detailed descriptions and explanations requiring the accurate use of specialized terminology to effectively communicate information to stakeholders
Proficient in self-planning skills sufficient to schedule, organize and manage multiple activities of varying complexity according to established plans and adjusting work schedules according to changing priorities, and time constraints
Well-developed analytical skills with strong attention to detail

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those under consideration will be contacted.

Please send your resume to hr@snapfinancial.com and reference: “Director, Reporting & Analytics” in the subject line.

Posting Description:

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Manager, Aon Advance, the Aon Advance Client Success Specialist(CSS) works as part of a team dedicated to ensuring the relationship between Aon and its clients is exceptional in every way.
Aon values all client relationships and recognizes there are some clients that may elect to have a more specialized servicing model to meet their unique business obligations. While we have designed our service processes to address our client's routine insurance administrative requests, we are also prepared to address this segment of our clients. In response to this defined segment we have created the Aon Advance Team, within Aon Client Services (ACS).

As a part of Aon Client Services (ACS), you and your colleagues located across Canada will oversee the client experience and specifically be very involved in activities related to placement of clients, invoicing activities and post placement activities. The nature of this national team will allow for significant opportunities for variety in your work and multiple avenues to continue to grow your career and engagement within Aon. You will be supported by world-class technology, training and development support and a national team that will seek your input into continuous improvement by seeking your insight on the voice of the client in assessing how we work.

While part of a national function, this role will be located in Toronto, Ontario. As such, you will benefit from being part of both a national team with colleagues across Canada as well as experiencing the unique aspects of being part of a close knit regional office.
Key Attributes/Competencies:
Client-centric go-getter who considers the voice of our clients in their decisions and actions
Strong Business acumen to support decision making and execution of activities
Strong understanding of insurance principles, specific knowledge and experience on working Global Placements and Specialty Groups an asset.
Team player willing to go above and beyond to deliver excellence in client service as part of the Aon Client Promise
Solid, persuasive and genuine communication skills
Good computer skills with proficiency in email, word processing and spreadsheet software
Comfortable learning and adapting to new technology
Post- secondary education or equivalent work experience
Minimum of 3-6 years progressive related
Hold appropriate license/s or willingness to obtain within 6 months of hire (mandatory)
Ability to work and communicate in both official languages (asset)
Able to adapt to change and communicate with others in /outside of the ACS team who need support to navigate a rapidly changing environment
Ability to maintain a positive attitude in a rapidly changing environment
Achieve the Aon Quality Standard of excellence with our work processes or outcomes and meet all regulatory requirements
A Day in the Life - Primary Responsibilities: (not an exhaustive list)
Resolve Complex post placement and basic inquiries associated with all aspects of Aon Client Services (ACS) service delivery (e.g. output delivery, basic invoice inquiries, etc.). 100% of Quality control on all post placement and Ad Hoc activity.
Extend assistance in planning and marketing initiatives to the Sales and Broking teams on handling unusual client requirements or complex processing transactions.
Identify and retrieve relevant compliance documentation necessary to process renewals, invoices, and any other ACS deliverables.
Perform necessary activities or support sales & broking teams in initiating a renewal, processing an invoice, issuing auto IDs, issuing renewal and urgent certificates, initiating endorsements and processing other client requests.
Monitor and attend to requests via Polaris that require actions in a timely manner.
Organize or assist sales & broking team members with the preparation of renewal submission and proposals and assist with the delivery of relevant outputs.
Ensure system of record (Xpress) is accurate and current to ensure outputs and client deliverables will be produced according to guidelines and policy detail.
Liaise and be responsive to inquiries from outsourced provider to manage and ensure the timeliness and quality of outputs.
Upload, index or attach documents in Document Management System.
Perform pre – renewal account review with the sales and broking team to meet client expectations related to timelines and to ensure accuracy of deliverables (certificates, invoices, endorsements, etc.).
Help colleagues troubleshoot and resolve basic client issues around ACS services.
With assistance from sales and broking, address and complete special client projects.
Participate in office and client visits where required.

We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:

From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Aon is committed to a diverse workforce as an Employment Equity employer (Women, People with Disabilities, Aboriginal Peoples, and Visible Minorities).

Who is Financeit?

jobTitle: Manager, FIU Strategy and Analytics - Tangerine
jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 88692
Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

At Tangerine, our purpose is to deliver best in class banking solutions to Canadians. We take a hands-on approach to challenges and always seek out opportunities to improve. Building a career at Tangerine is more than just a job; we are committed to making a difference in the lives of Canadians.
Who said that you have to hide your personality to deliver business results? We certainly do not, and that is what has made Tangerine a success. Come be a part of our collaborative, energetic and passionate client-centric team and continue to drive Forward Banking solutions for all Canadians.

Department Summary:
The Tangerine FIU (“FIU”) is responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining the Tangerine Anti-Money Laundering/ Anti-Terrorist Financing Program. Tangerine Bank is subject to, and must comply with many Regulations promulgated by governments, regulators and self-regulating bodies. The Department is responsible for ensuring that Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations as well as head office minimum standards. The Department is also responsible for ensuring adherence to sanctions regulations.
Role Purpose:
The Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics reports to the Senior Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics and provides technical support for the FIU. The Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics is responsible for leading the FIU Strategy & Analytics Team within the Tangerine FIU by developing, modifying, enhancing and maintaining technical solutions to help the FIU meet reporting requirements as well as managing the execution of the reviews for the FIU QA Program. The incumbent will inspire and motivate their team through coaching and development, and be responsible for driving improvements in productivity, decision effectiveness, and the customer experience.
Is this Role right for You?
Oversee the daily operations of the FIU Strategy & Analytics team in support of the FIU.
Provide technical support to the FIU team including the business as usual maintenance of the transaction monitoring, name screening and case management systems.
Lead the ongoing development and management of FIU systems, rules and deployed solutions by following a disciplined change management process.
Lead analytics and reporting to generate accurate and insightful perspective on rule effectiveness, detection rates, false positive rates and system volume.
Manage the FIU Quality Assurance Program
Operate as a liaison with internal and external business partners and represent the FIU Strategy & Analytics team in cross functional initiatives.
Maintain a thorough understanding of FIU system capabilities, gaps and opportunities for improvement.
Lead the hiring and performance management of the FIU Strategy & Analytics team.
Responsible for understanding and complying with the Regulatory Compliance Framework including the Anti-Money Laundering and Anti-Terrorist Financing and Sanctions Policy and all AML related policies, procedures and controls within the department.
Skills you need to Succeed?
University or College Degree or equivalent work experience
Minimum 3-5 years of related work experience within Financial Services industry, including leadership experience
Minimum 3 years of experience in Compliance and AML/ATF
Experience in consumer banking products / credit / deposit and cards.
ACAMs certification is considered an asset
Knowledge of AML/ATF requirements and systems and troubleshooting experience
Strong analytical skills
Strong technical solution management experience and skills
Strong working knowledge of programing languages (Visual Basic, SQL)
Proficiency in Microsoft office (Excel, PowerPoint ,Visio, etc.)

What’s in it for you.
You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team
We offer a competitive rewards package
Performance bonus, Share Ownership Program, and Pension Plan Matching
Health Benefits from day one!
Office perks: free healthy snacks (chocolate is healthy, right?) subsidized on-site cafeteria and parking
You will enjoy work life balance, team events, and opportunities to volunteer in the community.
Your career matters! You will have access to career development and progression opportunities.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : North York
At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

About Apotex Inc.
Apotex Inc. is a proudly Canadian, global pharmaceutical company that produces high-quality, affordable medicines for patients around the world. Apotex employs almost 8,000 people worldwide in manufacturing, R&D, and commercial operations. Apotex Inc. exports to more than 100 countries and territories and operates in more than 45 countries, with a significant presence in Canada, the US, Mexico, and India. Through vertical integration, Apotex is comprised of multiple divisions and affiliates including Apotex Inc., focused on generics; Apobiologix, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on biosimilar development; Aveva, an affiliate of Apotex Inc. fully integrated global developer and manufacturer of complete transdermal solutions; Apotex Consumer Products, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on brand name products; and Global Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (GAPI), a division of Apotex Inc. focused on the manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for Apotex and third parties. For more information visit: www.apotex.com.


Job Summary
The Manager, Global Supply Chain Analytics is responsible for executing fact-based analytics that provide insights and support decisions for Integrated Business Planning, GSTO strategy projects, Supply Chain Dashboards, and Continuous Improvement projects. This position also establishes and maintains regular KPI’s and a reporting program capable of providing value added analysis and insights to support day to day operations and executive actions.
This position will partner with Global Supply Chain, GIS, Commercial and GSTO to create standardized toolsets to support “one version” of the truth. This role will be the Enterprise SuperUser for GSTO Analytics, ensuring the right information systems, processes, policies and procedures that deliver significant value to the organization are in place.

Job Responsibilities
1.Analytics and Business Intelligence
oManage all the assigned Key Performance Metrics, including fill rate, inventory, etc. and distribute these metrics and corresponding analytics on a timely basis.
oResponsible for the execution of advanced analytical and modelling techniques to determine when KPIs are out of acceptable tolerances, determine root causes, and identify unfavourable trends requiring attention to ensure adequate service levels throughout the supply chain.
oProactively communicate potential performance issues and exceptions affecting the supply chain metrics, including actionable insights and recommendations.
oContinuously support the global supply chain team and other functional areas with data extracts, dashboard reporting and performance analytics support.
oRecognition and definition of key supply planning master data, both quantitative and qualitative, ensuring cross functional alignment and high quality of consistency and population to ensure a strong foundation for analysis.
oEnsure the right tools, systems, processes and policies are in place to plan, manage, and execute all assigned supply chain analytics.
2.Continuous Improvement and Project Management
oPerform advanced analysis on key initiatives and metrics to recommend actions that will increase efficiencies/reduce costs/drive revenue across the end to end supply chain.
oServe as project leader/business lead for the development of various reporting initiatives.
oLead predictive modelling projects to understand and enhance supply planning processes; develop project plans directing tasks of Consultants and Analysts.
oEnsure implemented actions/plans yield expected results and works to define and build new processes that effectively incorporate improvements.
oMaintain up-to-date expertise for a broad range of technical, analytical and information systems skills through attendance of user groups, in-house training and outside seminars
oResponsible for Supply Chain Planning training within and outside the Supply Chain Planning department.
3.Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Supply Review (SR) Process
oWithin the Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Supply Review Process, provide the mandated supply data, analyses and information to support the monthly cycle.
oManage and consolidate all the Integrated Business Planning (IBP) Supply Review Process Performance Metrics for the Global Apotex Supply Network.
4.Recruit, train, develop and manage effectively the ongoing performance of their direct reports, which includes, but is not limited to:
oEnsuring their Job Descriptions are reviewed, signed and sent to Employee Services, annually,
oReviewing and updating employee development plans, ensuring that all employees are properly trained and qualified to execute their duties,
oProviding coaching, feedback and recognition,
5.Responsible to ensure compliance of team members (direct reports) with Safety and Employment policies (e.g., Respect in the Workplace – Prevention of Violence and/or Harassment).
6.Works as a member of a team to achieve all outcomes.
7.Performs all work in support of our Corporate Values of Pride, Accountability, Integrity and Diligence; Demonstrates strong and visible support of our values.
8.Performs all work in accordance with all established regulatory and compliance and safety requirements.
9.All other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements
1. BS/BA degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Business or a Supply Chain/Operations discipline.
2. M.B.A., APICS CPIM certification and Lean Six Sigma certification or training would be an asset.
3. Minimum 5+ years of relevant experience in highly analytical, data intensive operations/supply chain management and/or finance roles.
4. Strong analytical skills with ample experience extracting/manipulating large amounts of data, and modelling and building complex reports through the use SQL, advanced Excel, relational database queries, QlikView or equivalent tools.
5. Robust knowledge of SAP Supply Chain Suite; experience with Advanced Planning & Optimization-Production Planning/Detailed Scheduling (APO-PP/DS) or equivalent Planning System, including expert knowledge of core SAP tables and data structure.
6. Strong knowledge of operational supply chain processes including the flow of materials and information.
7. Strong analytic fundamentals, high attention to detail and proficiency in analyzing large data sets to solve problems.
8. Expert level comfort interpreting vast amounts of data, synthesizing insights and providing actionable recommendations to relevant business leaders to drive decisions.
9. Experience in and knowledge of the Canadian and/or US generic pharma or related industry preferred.
10. Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex ideas in clear, simple and succinct ways, both orally and in writing, to all levels of the organization.
11. Demonstrated ability to champion change and drive improvements.
12. Self-Motivated, who can lead teams and motivate them to drive for results.
Department Review

At Apotex, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported.

Apotex offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

The primary focus of this role is to effectively implement data and attributes vision and strategy at GS1 Canada. As a Product Content Analyst, you will get an opportunity to work with creative and passionate data thinkers of the organization. You will get exposure to attribution models and be part of the strategic and operational implementation of data transformation.

The successful candidate will play a key role in our data team, and execute a team-first approach where the deliverables and goals of the organization supersede the goals of each individual department, and so the successful candidate will be an advocate for teamwork, openness, inclusiveness and enterprise-goal driven management.

If you are looking to grow your experience learning from highly skilled data experts and embark your journey into data management and product content analytics, this role is for you. You will be part of an upcoming team that tackles a complex data challenge and you will get first-hand experience solving complex challenges using data.

Duties and Responsibilities
Work very closely with Senior Product Content Analyst in the implementation of the attribution strategy and data model
Develop a deep understanding of the GS1 Canada business model, our services and applications and our unique industry governance model and build and enhance product attribution models to satisfy our subscriber data requirements in a manner that aligns to our subscriber needs
Become an organization expert in the area of subscriber product content data and content and play a leadership role in educating and distributing this knowledge throughout the organization
Maintain the wiki and governance practices established for attributes, manage attributes related operational activities for effective collaboration across the organization
Actively perform attribute mapping, process and flow diagramming and mapping for the Enterprise wide Data Solutions
Be a key integral member of the team that owns and governs GS1 Product Content Management
Build and maintain the master list of challenges and tasks identified from various pipelines and enable discussion and review for prioritization
Coordinate attributes related inquiries internally and act as a point of contact for any data management information across the organization
Become subject matter expert on everything attributes at GS1 Canada effectively work with Standards, Product and IT teams in the delivery of their initiatives
Participate the data integration framework and implementation discussions with partners, subscribers and key stakeholders
Collaborate with business analysis teams and participate in the development and build of new solutions design
Work with stakeholders across the organization to provide product content data support on business initiatives
Have a continuous improvement mindset to learn and advance data and analytics capabilities across the organization

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
3-4 years related experience, with bachelors or master’s degree in computer science or data related fields
Previous experience in a data analytical role aligning with reporting, predictive modeling and data visualization using SQL, R, Python, Power BI or Tableau
Significant experience performing data mapping, process flow diagramming
Expert command of spreadsheets and reporting tools
Proficient with SQL; other programming and analytical tool exposure is an asset
Expert command of spreadsheets and reporting tools
Strong attention to detail, with excellent organization and project management skills
Driven yet collaborative - you work well in an engaged, busy team environment
Proactive, organized, and results driven
Proficient verbal and written communication skills
Any experience working in a fast-paced software industry will be a good advantage
Ability to develop relationships with team members throughout the operation, gaining buy-in and building trust to facilitate
Project management and/or Agile experience.
Ability to adapt thinking and response to the geographic differences across our global operation

Aon is looking for an Assistant Vice President, Treaty
As a valued member of the leading broking firm in Canada, the focus of this role is to work very closely with the Canadian Reinsurance Broking Team to assist in the servicing of existing property and casualty treaty clients as well as the development of new business opportunities to generate meaningful revenue.

Job Summary:
It’s an exciting time to be at Aon! We are seeking a motivated and innovative Assistant Vice President, Treaty. You will be working in a dynamic, growth-oriented role uncovering opportunities and bringing valuable technical and financial solutions to insurance company clients and colleagues in the Aon World.

Your impact as an Assistant Vice President, Treaty
Core Responsibilities:
Assist with the development of sales and marketing strategies designed to cultivate revenue generation opportunities
Work with Treaty broking team in prospecting and servicing insurers, reciprocals and captives
Generate new opportunities resulting in meaningful Treaty revenue
Work closely in collaboration with the Treaty broking team as well as other Aon Business Units
Prepare reinsurance market submissions, negotiate terms and prepare formal contract documentation for clients and reinsurers
Attend meetings and/or functions with clients, prospects and reinsurers, on a regular basis
Moving forward with the Aon United agenda and delivering the best of our firm
 Required Experience:
5 or more years of experience within the reinsurance industry
Exceptional interpersonal skills with capability to interact with clients to cultivate strong relationships
Effective communicator (both verbally and in writing) with internal and external clients
Entrepreneurial attitude with high level of accountability for profitability and client satisfaction
Strong organization and time management skills; able to multi-task and manage projects
Ability to work independently as a self-starter; committed to delivering the highest in client service, quality and results
Strong analytical skills with ability to make sound business decisions
Proactive problem-solver who anticipates issues and suggests creative solutions
Ability to embrace change in support of the business unit’s and company’s goals
Strong proficiency and working knowledge of MS Office suite of products with ability to learn and use multiple software and system-based applications
Professional demeanor with positive attitude

Strong property and casualty technical understanding
 Education:
Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) in Business, Economics, Finance, or similar
We offer you
A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:
From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.

Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

Amazing role! We're an international media company, looking for a marketing executive for this fast-paced role managing the implementation of our subscriptions marketing campaigns. You'll need to get your sleeves rolled up working on a diverse portfolio of award-winning business magazines across North America.


The role involves:

driving magazine subscriptions marketing campaigns at a strategic and operational level
managing subscriber acquisition, retention and engagement campaigns
coordinating activity across multiple channels including strategic alliances, web, email, print, events and social media
liaising with sales, events and marketing colleagues at an international level
implementing multi-platform magazine readership engagement campaigns
briefing designers, copywriters and website professionals
analysing marketing data and providing recommendations


The successful candidate will have:

experience managing successful subscription campaigns
digital marketing experience
a proven track record of delivering strong ROI on marketing investment
the ability to apply skills on different levels simultaneously in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
some working knowledge of B2B media


The ideal candidate will be educated to degree-level or equivalent, and have previous experience in a subscriptions marketing role.


About us

Key Media is a rapidly growing business media company with offices in Sydney, Toronto, Auckland, Manila, Denver, London and Singapore, serving a range of professional services markets across the Asia-Pacific, North America and the UK.


The organisation’s products operate across key business verticals including Financial Services, Legal, Education, Property and Human Resources, bringing product providers and business communities together through print media, events and online channels. Key Media has an unquestioned reputation for delivering high-quality, timely information in whatever format best suits our customers.


In just over 18 years, Key Media has grown from the launch publisher of a single B2B magazine to a global business media company with an ever-growing portfolio of market-leading products. Key Media prides itself on its entrepreneurial culture, creating innovative products for the industries in which we operate.


Central to our business model is a truly platform-neutral approach to media communication. Whether audiences wish to communicate through the pages of a magazine, face-to-face at events, or online through the latest in cutting-edge technology, Key Media has a product to suit their needs.


“We believe there are no forms of media too old to thrive or too young to explore. We are always adapting and developing and looking for ways to improve our quality and expand our presence within our markets.”

Wanted: A User Experience Web Designer who can create useable, beautiful web experiences that inspire engagement.

PN is looking for a savvy web user experience designer who’s passionate about health, fitness and helping people live their best life.

Precision Nutrition is growing, and we need a creative and technically-savvy digital design expert who will help to take our sales and marketing website experiences to a new level of excellence by creating the intuitive experiences that inspire people to take action. As one of the largest nutrition coaching companies in the world, PN is bigger than it’s ever been — and it’s about to get bigger.

To help us scale, we need a passionate website designer who loves collaborating with others and designing frictionless, beautiful websites that will help our customers live healthier, happier lives.

Join our Adventure

We’re embarking on a new adventure, and we need an exceptional website designer who’s creative, innovative and passionate about improving people’s lives.

We’ve got an exciting journey ahead of us…Over the next 10 years, Precision Nutrition will be expanding its world-class education and coaching services into a wide range of new fields, including yoga, group exercise, sports coaching, athletics, manual therapy and more.

To help us reach our goals and keep us moving forward, we need a web design expert who knows how to work with a team to build unique, functional digital experiences that can ultimately drive sales growth.

Who we’re looking for

A designer who’s passionate about delighting visitors and inspiring action

You genuinely respect and appreciate your audience.

You understand that the key to great design is understanding your audience and delight them at every stage of their journey. When creating designs, you’re always putting yourself in the visitor’s shoes, questioning whether it’s relevant enough, intuitive enough, interesting enough, and clear enough.

Design is in your blood.

You have a natural affinity for design that tells you when something looks, feels, and sounds good. To you, clumsy user experiences, sloppy design, and ham-fisted copy are as impossible to ignore as a rock in your shoe.

You are an online optimization ninja.

You have a strong understanding of online optimization strategies, web analytics, and A/B testing. You’re obsessed with creating designs that optimize the visitor journey from the first landing page a visitor touches to the “submit order” button. You never settle. Instead you strive for continuous improvement.

You have no problem killing your darlings.

If someone challenges your ideas, you relish the opportunity to get feedback and improve. If you make a bad call, you don’t take it personally — you just figure out what went wrong and learn from it. You have an unfailing “win or learn” mentality, and are known for your resilience in high-stakes situations.

You encourage fearless creativity.

You think big and propose “crazy” ideas. You understand that inspired designs are the ones that get noticed, and that inspiration comes from an open, supportive creative environment.

You’re grounded in delivering business results.

While you appreciate fearless creativity, you balance this with an unflagging focus on the bottom line. At the end of the day, you understand that the designs you create ultimately drive sales, and are always thinking about ways to optimize and improve.

You’re excited about improving people’s health.

Our goal is to help people become healthier. Like us, you’re as passionate about telling stories as you are inspiring people to live their best lives.

You’re a motivating, team-oriented, people person.

You know how to communicate and coordinate. You earn and give respect so that you can collaborate with the team and persuade the right people of your recommendations. Oh, and since you get to do all of this remotely, from the comfort of your home, you won’t be going into an office every day to wrangle the team — so your people skills are truly first class.

You’re flexible.

You aren’t married to your ideas, and you understand that things change as new information is made available. You can switch gears at the drop of a hat and re-prioritize your work in a fluid, fast-paced environment, and you don’t sweat the small stuff — because your eyes are on the big picture.

You leave your ego at the door.

You have integrity and talent, you’re outgoing, and you have a palpable excitement about the future — without showing it off. You don’t have patience for shadiness, mediocrity, cynicism, or excessive "constructive criticism."

What you’ll be doing

Synthesizing visitor needs and business objectives into a beautiful digital experience that converts

You turn ideas into a reality, by putting (figurative) pen to paper. That means:

Shaping solutions for user-centered problems.

You’ll understand our customers and prospects deeply — who they are, what jobs they hire us for, and the qualitative or quantitative data needed to understand their optimal user experience. You’ll participate in the development of actionable user personas, journey maps and use cases for each audience persona to inform digital experience design and development. You’ll define user goals and requirements in collaboration with product marketing, digital marketing and key team members.

Developing designs that drive business outcomes.

You’ll be accountable for owning and driving the creative vision and visual design for the sales and marketing websites. You’ll make sure design solutions are customer-focused, intuitive and flawlessly executed — and artfully deliver real business results. Acting as a strategist and brand steward, you’ll design digital experiences that are both eloquent and practical and align with the PN brand.

Integrating insights and gathering feedback.

You have the ability to deeply understand and integrate customer needs and our business strategy into exquisite interactive web and mobile designs. You’ll champion a data-driven approach that utilizes analytics, AB testing and customer testing to inform design. You’ll also integrate usability principles and established standards to inform the design process. If you need more information, you’ll do some of your own guerilla user research, hopping on the phone with one of our coaches or checking the Facebook group to identify pain points and improve your design.

Maintaining and iterating.

You aren’t finished once the site is deployed — you’ll continually initiate ideas to enhance the digital experience, improve conversion, and drive sales. You’ll keep up with user feedback and participate in A/B testing to inform improvements and updates over time.

Define, document and evolve web design standards.

You’ll develop and refine standards and guidelines that serve as the foundation for designing cohesive experiences across PN web sites.


A few important caveats

This is a dream job, if you’re the right person for it.

Must-Have #1: You must be experienced.

This isn’t your first rodeo. You have at least 5 years of experience as a web site user experience designer for a consumer e-commerce website and have professional knowledge of user-centered design, usability principles and techniques. You know how to code on a basic level or have a strong understanding of how technology affects design. It’s not just about the design, but how it will function too. If you have experience doing user research and developing design systems, that’s a big plus. You must have a portfolio with examples of work to submit—and if you can share the results that work drove for the company, all the better.

Must-Have #2: You must have experience working closely with others on Agile teams.

You have experience working on Agile teams and enjoy working with a multidisciplinary team in an ever-changing, fast moving environment to solve challenges. You won’t just be drafting a design, handing it off, and moving onto the next thing. You’ll be working side-by-side with a small team, constantly iterating and improving.

Must-Have #3: You must be able to wear multiple hats.

PN is not a rigid structure. You’ll have your team, but you may also be asked to hop on another project when it’s needed, or switch gears. If you can heed that call and keep a few balls in the air, you’ll excel here.

Wondering if this is the right path for you?

Every year, professionals at the top of their field choose to join Precision Nutrition.

Here are some reasons why.

Reason #1: We give you the freedom to “do you.”

Unlike most companies, we don’t have rigid rules about how and when to do things. You’ll always be free to work independently, whenever, wherever, and however you want.

Reason #2: You can work from anywhere.

We’re a 100% remote company, and have been working remote for 17 years. When you join our team, you’re no longer shackled to one desk, one office, one city, or even one country!

Reason #3: Meetings are optional. (No, really.)

You’re an adult. You’re capable of deciding how your time should be spent. If you don’t think you need to attend a meeting, you don’t. Simple as that.

Reason #4: You’ll always feel supported.

In a regular office, it’s easy to feel like a hamster in a wheel, powerless to change things. At Precision Nutrition, we work as a team to overcome issues & barriers that stand in each other’s way, and we treat each other with enthusiasm, compassion, and care.

Reason #5: You’ll never be bored.

People often come to Precision Nutrition after hitting a plateau in their old jobs. At PN, you’ll get the chance to conquer new challenges, learn from the best, and reach thrilling new heights of personal and professional growth.

Reason #6: You’re free to be you.

At Precision Nutrition, we want everyone to live healthier, happier lives—no matter your race, age, gender, religion, or sexual orientation. That's why diversity is a key ingredient of our workforce, so we can best represent the people we serve. Everyone is welcome—as an inclusive workplace, we want our employees to bring their authentic whole selves to work. Be you.

Plus: no commute ... and no 9-to-5 grind.

Go ahead: schedule work around your kids. Fly to Europe on a moment’s notice. We don’t care where you’re based or what hours you keep, as long as you always give us your best when it counts.

Sound like we might just be the perfect company for you? Then you might just be the perfect fit for us. Click Apply for this Job below to get started!

Description
Are you passionate about reaching new heights, teamwork and making a meaningful contribution? Do you picture yourself as a valued member of an industry-leading organization? If you answered yes to these questions, Air Canada is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join the diverse and vibrant team working together to lead the growth and expansion of Canada’s flag carrier.

Reporting to the Manager, Advance Resource Planning, the Business Process Manager will evaluate, design and deliver process improvements related to Pilot and Flight Attendant Crew. The successful candidate will provide analytical expertise and business case support to the Crew Planning Department and drive initiatives that result in cost savings and process efficiencies.


This role requires business intuition and an ability to use analytical tools and methods to gain insights from data. The position will help define business cases and execute analytical initiatives creating sustainable improvements for the department.
Key Functions & Accountabilities:

Develop business cases, financial and operational analytics for projects specifically related to Crew coverage and staffing such as fleet changes, contract proposals, Transport Canada initiatives and revenue opportunities.
Leverage data from a variety of sources to analyze business performance identifying areas of opportunity and provide actionable insights to the Crew Planning Department.
Evaluate impact based on changes to regulatory/company work rules and the effect on required head count.
Design and implement statistical based models using improved data sources to further control crewing related costs. Update and enhance current models to account for changes in collective agreements and Transport Canada guidelines or to conform with new business processes.
Work closely with the Flight Crew Pairings team to provide feedback, including scenario testing, analysis of base openings/closures, base allocation, and new positions required.
Provide solutions, materials or guidance to Financial Analysis team on Revenue generating or cost control opportunities.
Create and maintain Pilot and Flight attendant forecasting models to optimize coverage required by the company’s schedule.
Design and implement vacation allocation models for Pilots and Flight Attendants to determine optimal vacation offered during the Annual vacation bid and reoptimize for future assignments/awards
Responsible for developing and maintaining operational and budget metrics, reporting on those metrics, and providing recommendations for their continuous improvement.
Conduct continuous adjustments to manpower plan to ensure coverage is optimized balancing commercial revenue needs and costs.
Prepare and present operational post analysis, observations and recommendations to internal resources.
Work collaboratively with Crew Planning teams to design KPIs to track schedule opportunities and corrective actions
Provide support for equipment bid preparation, modeling, and analysis
Responsible for identifying recommendations for process improvements in coordination with various business process owners
Effectively communicate findings and complex analytical solutions to upper management
Support the entire department in search for increased efficiencies and potential process improvements

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in relevant field or equivalent experience/training
Airline experience or demonstrated interest in Airline business
Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail
Ability to thrive in project environments that often start with uncertain requirements or outcomes; ability to put definition and structure around problems and projects
Can communicate complex quantitative concepts in a clear, precise and actionable manner
Proven proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Ability to manage multiple tasks and short deadlines
Ability to work with cross-functional groups and quickly develop relationships
Ability to logically structure analysis of complex issues and develop creative solutions
Creative and curious
LINGUISTIC REQUIREMENTS


Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Overview:

As one of North America’s largest independent manufacturers of consumer packaged goods (“CPG”), KIK helps a large portfolio of brands and retailers bring their products to life. With leading positions in the multibillion dollar household and personal care (“HPC”), over-the-counter (“OTC”), pool additives and automotive aftermarket categories, we serve over 100 CPG companies and several major North American HPC and automotive aftermarket retailers, including many of the leading players in their respective categories. We have full-service capabilities covering end-to-end contract manufacturing, including project management, innovation and R&D, sourcing and procurement, blending and compounding, filling and packaging, supply chain and distribution, and quality control. Our manufacturing model is highly flexible and we consistently add value to our customers by leveraging our range of services and expertise.

KIK has over 5,000 employees and operates 29 manufacturing facilities strategically located throughout North America. KIK also has commercial and operating activities in other countries across the Globe: including the United Kingdom, Europe, China, Mexico and Australia.

Position Summary
The Business Intelligence (BI) Solutions Architect position is part of the KIK Custom Products – Information Systems team. The incumbent will be responsible for designing, building, implementing BI solutions for the company. This role will work closely with analytics developers. He/she will use his/her technical expertise to bridge the gap between the business problem and the technology solution. The incumbent will support the processes in a standard-based environment, deployed globally and accessible across the organization.

This role is based in Concord, ON but will have responsibilities for global locations with travel requirements ranging from 10-15%.
Responsibilities:

Solutions Building
Lead BI projects during all the phases of the project life cycle, with emphasis on business requirements gathering, quality assurance and user acceptance phases.
Design, direct and implement business intelligence solutions, including business requirements, design, development and deployment.
Own relationship with the business users and schedule meetings with business users and analytics developers.
Be the voice of the business user to the BI/Analytics team accelerating the adoption of new BI projects across the organization.
Identify risks with solution and communicate with business users to proactively resolve or mitigate risks/delays to the BI projects.
Engage technical and non-technical business users in project communications, using appropriate language and terminology for the intended audience.
With business stakeholders define, challenge, and prioritize BI projects.
Transform business requirements into BI solutions.
Analyze different sources of data and document technical specifications for analytics developers.
Support quality assurance and user acceptance tests.
Work with analytics developers to guide development, participate in code reviews, to ensure technical and functional integrity of BI projects.
Responsible for promoting the BI project to production environments.

BI Training and Governance
Schedule and perform BI training sessions with the key business users.
Monitor progress and usage of the BI reporting tools across the organization.
Work with business users to establish proper governance for creation, publication and sharing of BI reports and dashboards.
Own the BI license assignment across the organization.
Work with the Director Integration and Analytics and the CIO to establish and design the Business Intelligence Governance across the organization.

Leadership
Provide leadership and direction to the BI/Analytics team ensuring high level of engagement, motivation and innovation.
Identify opportunities to strengthen the capability of the BI practice such as: mentoring employees, promoting technical developments, and building networks.
Act as a positive role model and provide architectural expertise, direction, and assistance to BI/analytics developers
BI Practice
Develop proficiency in the BI technologies, including but not limited to BI (Power BI, Qlikview), ETL (SSIS) and RDBMS (SQL Server, Azure SQL Server).
Stay current in BI industry and business trend through attending networking events, individual learning and participation in BI webinar and conferences.
Identify and research relevant technologies, perform Proof of Concepts (POC), prototypes, reviewing and recommending technology trends.
Develop, implement and maintain best practices and standard for delivery of quality BI solutions.
Document business and technology roadmaps for the BI team.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Information Management, Computer Science, or another business-related field is preferred.
10+ years of experience in BI projects including 5+ years as a Solutions Architect in BI/Analytics
Experience building Power BI reports through a web-based environment
Experience training uses in BI tools
5+ yeas of experience building Functional and Technical specifications for BI projects
Strong presentation skills, for all business user levels using technical and no-technical language
Microsoft SSIS, Visual Studio 2015 and above.
Knowledge of cloud applications.
Expert knowledge of RDBMS (Oracle, MSSQL).
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure technologies.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, written, and listening communication skills.
Time management and analytics skills.

The above statements describe the general nature and level of work only. They are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, or this description amended at any time.

A Career with KIK Offers:

KIK offers very competitive salary and comprehensive benefits including health, wellness, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance. You can plan for your future with KIK's retirement savings options including employer match. KIK also recognizes the importance of continuing education and offers Education Assistance to our employees to encourage continued personal development and growth.

Thank you for your interest and consideration of a position with KIK Custom Products.

KIK is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, age, religion, sex, or national origin.

ThoughtWire’s smart building and smart hospital software solutions empower its clients in commercial real estate and healthcare to optimize building operations and improve occupant experience by orchestrating data from people, processes, and the connected building in a smart digital asset - the Built Environment Digital Twin.


ThoughtWire’s innovative applications that are deployed in the cloud and on-premise, are all powered by ThoughtWire’s Built Environment Digital Twin, which breaks down silos of data to deliver the right information to the right people in context so they can take action. Whether it’s creating a seamless experience for officer workers inside a building or streamlining clinical operations, ThoughtWire is determined to make built environments healthier, safer, and more efficient places to live, work and play.


Who we’re looking for:

We are looking for a motivated and talented Delivery Consultant that is technically savvy and business focused. The Delivery Consultant is highly collaborative, has a passion for technology at the core, and is passionate about utilizing technology to achieve real outcomes in new environments.

This position will put you in front of our clients in the thick of solution delivery of our leading edge platform that combines the best of machine intelligence, situational awareness and workflow automation to solve real world problems in smart buildings, healthcare, and factory automation.

You'll be leading a highly collaborative project team in the delivery of solutions to integrate with a range of systems, interfaces, and connected sensors in order to improve our customer’s outcomes through improved user experience and workflow automation. We work with a multitude of industries that require high scalability, security, reliability, and elegant solutions to hard problems.

As a Delivery Consultant you will review, analyze and evaluate business systems, processes and user needs. You will conduct agile, design thinking workshops with external customers to determine scope and need for the customer solution. You will lead the client solution design effort in close collaboration with the Solution Architect, the Engineering team and most importantly the Customer. You will be reporting to the Director of Technical Services Group.

What you'll be doing:


Deliver exceptional customer value through ThoughtWire products in Smart Building / Smart Hospital suites
Manage all phases of multiple projects from initiation to closure while leveraging best practice standards and processes
Collaborate with clients on a daily basis to clarify requirements, negotiate decisions, handle feature issues, provide an escalation point, and to perform project and risk management
Lead and deliver ThoughtWire workshops with stakeholders such as end-users, business operations, and technical SMEs to gather and clarify requirements for the implementation
Engage in customer onsite discovery which may include location mapping, integration or application testing, and coordinating onsite hardware setup
Lead and support the development and dissemination of the project artifacts as needed, such as: Request for Proposals, Statements of Work, Project Plans, Business Requirements Documentation, change requests, presentations, and briefing notes for all levels of the internal & external stakeholders
Monitor and report on project progress, problems, and solutions to all stakeholders and escalate issues as required
Participate in production rollout planning including training, project launch, and post project go-live support
Collaborate with internal teams such as Sales, Engineering, Product, and Customer Success, keeping them in the know about plans, ongoing delivery, and any meaningful changes that may arise
Prioritize efforts and resources across multiple projects, which requires consideration on capacity requirements and opportunities
Execute current implementation methodology on projects and continuously refine and improve current processes.


What you’ll need


3+ years of experience in project management
Workshop facilitation experience, with confidence in leading customer workshops including a variety of participants, such as senior executives, technical personnel, and business users
Experience with OT infrastructure in buildings such as building automation systems, lighting, IoT sensors, occupancy sensors, Energy Management etc.
Impeccable oral and written English communication skills
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with keen attention to detail
Strong consulting skills with a high degree of professionalism
Proven success in juggling multiple projects based on strong self-management and time management skills
Customer focused with a track record of taking initiative
Strong self-management and time management skills in a multi-project environment


Experience / Skill set in any of these will make you stand out


Experience in startup environment
Experience in design and integration of building automation systems
Understanding of control systems and infrastructure (Network/Wi-Fi, schematics, control modules, element managers, line control systems, etc.)
Engineering degree or equivalent, specializing in electronics, electrical, mechanical or controls engineering
Hands on experience with OT system integration such as Building Automation Systems, Lighting systems etc.
Hands on experience with occupancy sensor data integration and or occupancy specific use cases and analytics in buildings


Why you want to work for us


Great colleagues, mentorship, and meaningful socially impactful work
Full benefits package from your start date - no waiting period!
Competitive salary
Flexible hours and work from home options
Great office location in Toronto’s Market District; near St. Lawrence Market
Short walk to Union Station or King Station; steps from the King streetcar
Healthy snacks and free drinks

Canada's Challenger Bank™
If you're looking for a workplace where employees are passionate about their work environment, then read on. What sets Equitable Bank apart from other companies is its culture. We celebrate and embrace the fabric of diversity, the employee engagement process and collectively take pride in our business successes. Our commitment to our customers, our partners and our employees creates a stimulating and exciting atmosphere that generates innovative products and outstanding service quality.

Equitable Bank is Canada's ninth largest independent Schedule I bank, serving Canadians coast to coast. It offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs. Through its proven branchless approach and customer service focus, Equitable Bank has grown to approximately $33 billion in assets under management. In 2016, Equitable Bank launched a digital banking operation, EQ Bank, and introduced the EQ Bank Savings Plus Account. Equitable Bank currently employs over 750 employees across the country.

Within Equitable Bank's Core Lending business, Single Family Lending Services funds mortgages for owner-occupied and investment properties across Canada, while Commercial Lending Services provides mortgages on a variety of commercial properties on a national basis.Equitable's Securitization Financing business originates and securitizes insured residential mortgages under the Canada Mortgage and Housing ("CMHC") administered National Housing Act.Equitable Bank also offers a range of deposit products including short-term, long-term and Cashable GICs, available in non-registered or Tax Free Savings Account ("TFSA") across Canada. And it offers a High Interest Savings Account, available from authorized investment advisors through the FundServ network.

Equitable Bank is a growing Canadian financial services business and a wholly owned subsidiary of Equitable Group. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company.

Title: Digital Banking Payments & Innovation Manager
Department: Digital Banking - Payments, Innovation & Analytics, EQ Bank
Reports to: Senior Director, Digital Banking Payments & Innovation

Purpose of the Job

The overall objective of this role is to support the payments roadmap, coordinate execution of the payments products, increase share of market, and improve competitive position of the digital bank, ultimately furthering Equitable’s position as “Canada’s Challenger Bank”. Product responsibility will include EQ Bank’s suite of payment products, including EFT, Interac e-Transfer, EQ to EQ Transfer, Bill Payment, and Payments card. The Digital Banking Payments & Innovation Manager will lead the exploration, development, and launch of a payment card and manage the performance of the program, including refinement of the product’s value proposition and development of strategies to drive usage. This role will report into the Senior Director, Digital Banking Payments & Innovation.

Main Activities and responsibilities:

Assist in development of strategy, direction and roadmaps for Payments products for the digital bank

Purpose:
The Educational Developer is a hands-on, supportive role crucial to the successful implementation of outcomes-based learning and teaching. The position will provide pedagogic expertise to all full-time and part-time faculty during a culture shift, a time of significant change in pedagogical assessment and evaluation in higher education to focus more on outcomes. This position will implement strategies and approaches to serve as a catalyst for knowledge sharing, champion innovation and creative practices in teaching and learning approaches, support programs and teams of individuals to enhance teaching practice. The Educational Developer will model, inform, facilitate and support pedagogical related activities, providing assistance for different learning modalities and frameworks. At the same time the Educational Developer will ensure that learning outcomes and pedagogical effectiveness are measured through robust evaluation systems that feed into the School's various mechanism of continuous improvement.

Education:
Master's in Education. PhD in Education or an MEd combined with a degree in engineering preferred.

Experience:
A minimum of 5 years' experience in post-secondary education, and 3 years' experience in educational development within a college or university environment. (Engineering related educational curriculum design and implementation experience an asset). Experience implementing plans for outcomes based assessment and monitoring student performance at a program and course level.

Skills:
Excellent knowledge of current theories and practices in education, particularly with respect to post-secondary teaching and learning (e.g. student diversity, large classes, small groups, team-based learning, blended and online learning, experiential education, e-learning, flipped classroom), and educational development. Ability to create and deliver programming (informal and formal stand-alone or embedded activities) for teaching development. Excellent analytical reasoning, problem solving, time management, planning, project management, supervisory, administrative and organizational skills. Knowledge of and experience in program evaluation frameworks such as Quality Assurance, or Accreditation, and understanding of approaches to quality enhancement within these environments would be an asset. Excellent oral and written communication skills with some experience with academic and professional writing. Demonstrated commitment to client service and professionalism in consulting with clients, identifying needs and facilitating solutions. Demonstrated ability to effectively lead and collaborate on cross-functional and multi-disciplinary teams, multi-tasking and establishing priorities and meeting deadlines with minimal direction. Strong functional understanding with Learning management systems, adaptive learning systems and Learning Analytics and the use of Web 2.0 technologies for educational purposes using a VLE. Membership of and engagement with a relevant professional body such as Education Development Centre (EDC), the Professional and Organizational Development Network in Higher Education (POD) or SEDA (Staff and Educational Development Association) is preferred.

Additional Notes:
A diverse, complex, fast paced environment, requiring consultations with individuals and groups.
The incumbent will be working in an open concept offce environment with distractions and interruptions.
This role will require excellent listening skills and the ability to concentrate and analyze the information provided by others.

Reporting to the Assistant Director, Student Recruitment, the Regional Recruitment Manager, China plays a key role in developing a strong enrolment pipeline from China through the implementation of recruitment, communications, relationship development and enrolment management strategies.
